urls.title: CRAIG SCANLON - Craigness
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Oh! Brother on Spotify. Not for the first time, 3 members of the band The Fall met for a pint on a Friday lunchtime in Manchester. What sets this one apart is that someone had the good grace to record it. Paul, Steve and Craig sit down to discus their time together in the Fall and mainly argue about who wrote what. Despite not remembering when or where anything was written, they all remember that they definitely wrote it. Our GDPR privacy policy was updated on August 8, 2022. Visit acast.com/privacy for more information.

urls.title: Oh! Brother
urls.description: Tales from one of Britain's most influential post-punk bands, The Fall. From the rhythm section that brought you Hex Enduction Hour, brothers Paul and Steve Hanley provide insight and anecdotes from their time in the band, along with interviews with other members, people involved with the band and fans from the world of music and beyond. See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

tweets.text: I just finished listening to the latest @OhBrotherShow with @dannykellywords what a great podcast that was, I didn’t want it to end. Please do another again in the future lads. I’ve listened to every one of your podcasts now over the last 7 weeks & they are absolutely brilliant.

Many thanks to @outonbluesix @C86Show @PermRecordPod @OhGodWhatNowPod @juderogers @OhBrotherShow @pop_rambler @LordWakering @tiny_air @ChrisShawEditor @BeatlesPod @CriminalShow and @ChartMusicTOTP for some great podcasts this year.
Best podcasts this year by some distance @BacklistedPod @andrewhankinson Logroll and @OhBrotherShow
@OhBrotherShow @dannykellywords Listened to this with a massive grin on my face the whole way through. 😊
Have just found the Fall podcast @OhBrotherShow via @dannykellywords appearance this month. It’s totally wired - get on it.
What a lovely chat, so full of good nature I almost got a bit weepy as they all waved goodbye to each other. https://t.co/2PC497mfnm

And absolutely this, even though I don't listen to The Fall these days the stories are great
@OhBrotherShow

@dannykellywords great guest, proper raconteur. I’ll dig my tape recording of John Peels 50th birthday gig out from 1989 and listen out for the insults. Another brilliant episode https://t.co/zfybfyPmGf
16 hours of travel only to completely miss the gig (long,gruesome story) and the only thing that kept me going was 16 hours of the @OhBrotherShow. The Fall saved my life again.

I've listened to @OhBrotherShow in 3 tranches today. All of them in different slices of very Salfordian life.
'I don't want to butter you both up...because I'm sure you're both full of..it' says @dannykellywords is the best bit of the day though. A brilliant episode. Perfect. https://t.co/XkjWFCDfax

@dannykellywords @OhBrotherShow Excellent chat. You got Paul and Steve into some detailed discussion. Re the scene in Control, Rob Gretton loved The Fall. He said (to me, early 80s) they were the only group around making a genuinely new kind of music.
This episode FLEW by. @dannykellywords II would be very welcome. https://t.co/xS6idPrtwC

@JohnCains1 @OhBrotherShow @apaindoc @Stephenhanley6 Yes I am (though I’m not really a fan of FB) We’ll also be setting up Oh! Brother FB and Instagram accounts shortly.

It’s that time again. This week Marcia Schofield @apaindoc joins the guys. The former keyboardist and current doctor speaks about her time in The Fall, the infamous Hey! Luciani and we learn how a life of touring is like constantly going on holiday without any of the fun. Enjoy!

The five former-Fall members have joined together as HOUSE Of ALL. Their self-titled album will be released Spring 2023 & we're planning a very limited run of live shows to celebrate this unexpected coming together of former soldiers of The Fall. Aren’t we lucky! https://t.co/DLWovi5nRB

#Nowlistening @OhBrotherShow mit @Nolanwriter

urls.title: CRAIG SCANLON - Craigness
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Oh! Brother on Spotify. Not for the first time, 3 members of the band The Fall met for a pint on a Friday lunchtime in Manchester. What sets this one apart is that someone had the good grace to record it. Paul, Steve and Craig sit down to discus their time together in the Fall and mainly argue about who wrote what. Despite not remembering when or where anything was written, they all remember that they definitely wrote it. Our GDPR privacy policy was updated on August 8, 2022. Visit acast.com/privacy for more information.

tweets.text: @ChrisBuStuff @OhBrotherShow The show is itself like The Fall: a dense, Mancunian stream-of-consciousness tour de force 🙂
@scuutes @OhBrotherShow . Obviously best if you like The Fall but actually the conversation drifts across lots of subject matters. Very enjoyable.

Reading You Must Get Them All, listening to Hex Enduction on low having completed series 2 of @OhBrotherShow this week, planning ahead to the Mighty Fall gathering in Mcr in a month or so.
Who'd have thought the undemisely time of MES would bring about ANOTHER halcyon Fall era?!

Following on from the great @OhBrotherShow Stewart Lee episode, don't forget Stew's very Fall-centric feature length print-only conversation, compiled here: 
@ChromaEditions order info at: https://t.co/uuTPRYVWGZ https://t.co/o9hZRHaZdc

urls.title: Oh! Brother
urls.description: Tales from one of Britain's most influential post-punk bands, The Fall. From the rhythm section that brought you Hex Enduction Hour, brothers Paul and Steve Hanley provide insight and anecdotes from their time in the band, along with interviews with other members, people involved with the band and fans from the world of music and beyond. See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

urls.title: Listeners' Choice Award — British Podcast Awards
urls.description: Vote for your favourite podcast in the Listeners' Choice Award supported by Acast+

tweets.text: I've voted for Oh! Brother - https://t.co/Md02AIopLj in the @britpodawards Listeners' Choice Award. Vote for your Oh! Brother: https://t.co/Yp7UH6zYUc. @OhBrotherShow
@longrally @hawkbinge for Hawkwind and @OhBrotherShow for the Fall. Both excellent

Huge congratulations to this guy @NathanJHanley (he's on the left) who's just got his honours degree from @sheffielduni  - the last few years certainly weren't the easiest time to do a degree but he did brilliantly. Me & @juliehanley1 couldn't be prouder!! https://t.co/2UQswQGIm6

urls.title: The Fall - Eat Y'Self Fitter (1983)

tweets.text:
#FallFriday 

Been re-listening to the excellent 'Oh Brother!' podcasts by @hanleyPa and @Stephenhanley6 and how disgusting the drinks were in the Eat Y'Self Fitter video. Also, I like songs packed with lyrics. So...enjoy again:

https://t.co/V7DzhTOQS0

urls.title: MARC RILEY & CRAIG SCANLON - Live from the Old Folks Home
urls.description: Listen to this episode from Oh! Brother on Spotify. Coming to you live from a bustling Manchester ale house (if you couldn't tell), four of the Falls most influential members convene for a retrospective into their time in the band. With apologies to fans of high fidelity. And Geoff Travis. And Mike Finney for forgetting his surname. And Kelly's (the venue). Memory not guaranteed. See acast.com/privacy for privacy and opt-out information.

tweets.text:
For #FallFriday i strongly recommend this episode of @OhBrotherShow with hosts the Hanley bros and messrs Scanlon and Riley. Key members of the group the Fall

https://t.co/ZuPEsAjfxr

@OhBrotherShow @marcrileydj This ep. definitely needs a part 2 in next series. For us listening from afar, the records are our memory triggers. I hear Slates and it takes me straight back to what I was doing & how I felt when I was 20. Hearing stories of how those records were actually made is fascinating.
@OhBrotherShow great stuff @OhBrotherShow hope there’s more to come. A suggestions for a potential future guest, David Lloyd (ex cricketer, very funny and huge Fall fan)!
@OhBrotherShow @marcrileydj Another brilliant episode in an outstanding series. Looking forward to S3 already
Mr Craig Scanlon speaks!! @marcrileydj is always a treat but with Craig in the mix this makes for a cracker final @OhBrotherShow https://t.co/fPelT8mOSH
We'd like to thank every one of our guests this season, and everyone who has downloaded, listened, reviewed or shared the show. Keep a weather eye out for series 3.

@marcrileydj Background audio was a little louder than we would have liked, but we have done our best to save this episode as it would be criminal to let this one sit in the archive. Some bonus clips will be with you throughout the week!

@OhBrotherShow Any interest in doing a special Fall In A Hole episode later this year? 40yr anniversary of the NZ tour this August. 

My book coming out in November has a whole entry on it and lots of other tidbits. Could get a couple cool guests together. Follow & DM if interested

Unfortunately, there will be no new episode this week due to bank-holiday-related commitments, but next week’s episode, the last in the current series, features TWO very special guests, and will hopefully be worth the wait
Another superb episode of this Fall-related podcast featuring previous carousel rider @hanleyPa , his brother @Stephenhanley6 and Clint from the Inspiral Carpets https://t.co/Lhi7E7p1WV
It was an absolute honour to do this podcast with the Hanley brothers @OhBrotherShow. Thanks for having me fellahs xxx #TheFall https://t.co/0tlePprnI2

tweets.text: New episode alert! DJ, Composer and Inspiral Clint Boon joins us this week. The guys discuss the difference between collaborating with and being in The Fall, the main difference being an invite to Top of the Pops, but no one tell Steve. Hope you enjoy! https://t.co/yBhysf7yQW
Love this episode, who knew Mark asked Clint to join the band? On reflection I wish he’d accepted the offer https://t.co/i4G9ePqYOc
